FuncDef:
The dhcp server request-packet all-interface command enables or disables the DHCP server function on all interfaces.
By default,the DHCP server function is disabled on all interfaces.
CLIs: dhcp server request-packet all-interface { enable | disable }

ParaDef.Info:
Enables the DHCP server function on all interfaces.
-

Disables the DHCP server function on all interfaces.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
By default, the DHCP server function is disabled on all interfaces. To enable the DHCP server function on all interfaces, run the dhcp server request-packet all-interface enable command. After the command is run, all interfaces allow users to go online.
Precautions
If the DHCP server function is enabled in the system view but disabled in the view of an interface, this function is disabled on the interface. in this case, the interface does not allow users to go online.If the DHCP server function is disabled in the system view but enabled in the view of an interface, this function is enabled on the interface. in this case, the interface allows users to go online.
